characters: LISTEN WHEN I TALK TO YOU

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The street is empty save for the garbage that waits for collection. Rotten haystacks of moldered meat, soiled diapers, and sour milk crowd the sidewalks and stoops. A HISS OF STEAM bursts from a sewer grate. It RISES UP li a spirit, skirting the face of a crumbling Catholic churc the sound of wind WHISTLES through CREAKING rafters. An o rat SKITTERS along a rain gutter matted with dry leaves. noise is exaggerated, amplified into a symphony of sounds DRIP. DRIP. DRIP. DROPS OF BLOOD trickle down a stained glass window; cutti clear trail across the dusty pane. We trace the blood tra up to a large CRUCIFIX at the roof’s peak. DRIP. DRIP. DRIP. DRIP. The droplets become rivulets as we reveal a SILHOUETTE dr over the cross. The silhouette of a devil. A SEARCHLIGHT from a POLICE HELICOPTER cuts a path across the rooftops, revealing the devil to be a man in costume. This is DAREDEVIL. So forget what you know about superheroes. Because this i the real world. And in the real world there is no such th as “mutant healing’ or “spider sense” to keep a man alive In the real world there's just a guy in a mask. And he’s bleeding to death.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A skylight CREAKS OPEN and the devil slowly hangs down in the church before hitting the floor with an ugly THUD.

dialogues.speaker: CUT TO
dialogues.text: A PAIR OF SHOES stopping at the sound. CAMERA TILTS UP to reveal the weathered face of a priest, FATHER EVERETT. He opens the door to the sanctuary to discover... THE DEVIL. Curled up on the altar; like a pill bug swallowing its pa (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The old priest runs to the devil's side and cradles his h before pulling back his crimson cowl to reveal... MATT MURDOCK. The searchlight hits Matt’s eyes through the skylight. Bu we PUSH IN we notice his pupils never dilate. They say yo whole life flashes before you when you die. And it’s true Even for a blind man.

dialogues.speaker: THOSE SAME EYES
dialogues.text: before they went blind. We PULL BACK to reveal MATT AT 14 YEARS OLD. He sports a cut lip and a bloody nose as he stands over a kitchen sink. He splashes his face with col water and watches as the blood swirls down the drain...

dialogues.speaker: MATT
dialogues.text: Dad? I’m home. He steps into the living room to find his father passed o - in front of the T.V. JACK MURDOCK. He’s a handsome man despite a nose that’s been broken too many times to count

dialogues.speaker: T.V. RING ANNOUNCER
dialogues.text: And the winner, by unanimous decision... Gene “The Machine’ Conlan! Matt CLICKS the T.V. off and pries a beer bottle from his father’s fingers before pulling him to his feet.

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: +. .™mm...wha...who...who won?

dialogues.speaker: MATT
dialogues.text: Conlan. By decision. We TRACK THEM as Matt eases his father down the hall...

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: I beat ‘em, you know...

dialogues.speaker: MATT
dialogues.text: I know, Dad.

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: Two...years ago...it was a...

dialogues.speaker: MATT
dialogues.text: T.K.O. They threw in the towel. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They pass some old fight bills hanging in the hallway. Th show Jack posing in a red satin boxing robe with two smal horns sewn into the hood. JACK “THE DEVIL" MURDOCK.

dialogues.speaker: IN THE BEDROOM
dialogues.text: Matt wrestles his shoes off as Jack notices his cut lip.

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: What‘s this?

dialogues.speaker: MATT
dialogues.text: Nothin’.

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: I told you I don’t want you fighting.

dialogues.speaker: MATT
dialogues.text: I don’t fight. I get beat up. There's a difference.

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: Matt...

dialogues.speaker: MATT
dialogues.text: I tried to walk away. Like you said. But they kept giving me shit.

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: Don’t curse. What kinda shit?

dialogues.speaker: MATT
dialogues.text: (hesitant) They said you work for Fallon. They said you’re one of his guys now. A LONG BEAT as Jack looks to his son’s pleading eyes.

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: Think I‘d be bustin’ my hump down at the- docks if I was working for Fallon? Matt smiles, relieved.

dialogues.speaker: JACK, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: You just keep hitting the books, you hear? Be a doctor or a lawyer. Not like me.

dialogues.speaker: MATT
dialogues.text: Sure, Dad.

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: Promise me. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: MATT
dialogues.text: I promise. Jack pats Matt’s cheek.

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: She woulda been proud, Matty... And with that he falls back asleep. Matt SIGHS and steps over to the window, gazing out to the rooftops that stret forever. As CAMERA CLOSES ON the FULL MOON we

dialogues.speaker: A BIOHAZARD WARNING
dialogues.text: in a circular design, FILLING FRAME, before a FORKLIFT carrying a PALLET OF DRUMS turns to reveal that we're on:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Matt quickly weaves through the busy docks with a card in hand, searching for his father when:

dialogues.speaker: HEY
dialogues.text: Matt spins around to face the SUPERVISOR.

dialogues.speaker: SUPERVISOR
dialogues.text: You trying to get yourself killed?

dialogues.speaker: MATT
dialogues.text: I’m looking for my dad. Jack Murdock.

dialogues.speaker: SUPERVISOR
dialogues.text: Murdock? He ain’t worked here for over six months. Now beat it. He turns, crestfallen, and tosses the card into a mud pud We PUSH IN to reveal it’s his REPORT CARD. Straight A’‘s Cur TO:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Matt trudges back for home when:

dialogues.speaker: VOICE
dialogues.text: Please...please... He steps AROUND THE CORNER to find a MEAT PACKER in a blo apron, shoved up against a wall by a THUG in a ski mask. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: MEAT PACKER
dialogues.text: You gotta tell Fallon I need more time!

dialogues.speaker: THUG
dialogues.text: You're all out of time. Matt freezes at the voice.

dialogues.speaker: MATT
dialogues.text: Dad? The Thug stops and turns to face us. A LONG BEAT before h slowly slips his ski mask off to reveal... JACK MURDOCK. Matt shakes his head as tears come to his eyes. And then turns and runs off down the alley.

dialogues.speaker: ON MATT
dialogues.text: Running out toward the loading docks, blinded by tears, h father chasing behind him. BRAKES SCREECH as... A TRUCK swerves to avoid him. Loaded with the same barrel seen earlier. At the same time... A FORKLIFT swerves as well, its forks up high. They tear through the barrels as... Matt looks up. Whitish fluid flies INTO CAMERA as we...

dialogues.speaker: BLACKNESS .
dialogues.text: We hear the sound of CHURCH BELLS RINGING. And as the sou grows a ghostly SHADOW WORLD begins to take shape. A worl where sound isn’t just heard--but seen. A BUS ROARS past us as the shadows collapse and distort i a monstrous phantasm of visible vibration. A HORN HONKS,. A CELL PHONE RINGS. A BABY CRIES. With eac noise our shadow world spills and pools, like liquid merc CcuT TO: (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: as he steps into the hospital room, his eyes red and tire He stops when he sees an empty bed.

dialogues.speaker: JACK, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Matt?

dialogues.speaker: MATT, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: He turns to find Matt before the open window with his eye bandaged. He holds up his hand for silence. Then: MATT (cont'd) Do you hear it?

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: What? Matt turns to him.

dialogues.speaker: MATT
dialogues.text: Everything. Jack shakes his head, trying to find some way to tell him

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: I talked to the doctor. He said--

dialogues.speaker: MATT
dialogues.text: I’m blind. I know.

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: But how--

dialogues.speaker: MATT
dialogues.text: I could hear you talking in his office. Jack looks back to where he was. Impossible. MATT (CONT’D) Something’s happening to me. I don’t know what it is, but I’m not afraid. Jack bows his head as the guilt washes over him.

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: I'm sorry. I’m so sorry... He breaks down as Matt holds him in his arms. The blind b comforting the big fighter as we... (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MUSIC UP: HIGHER by Creed. Dappled rays of sunlight break through the gray cloud cov over the Hudson. It’s a new day. cuT TO:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jack has turned the roof into a makeshift gymnasium. He takes a few tentative swings at an old heavy bag while Ma sits on a weight bench with a BRAILLE TEXT on his lap. Th agonizing process of learning to read all over again. Jack sighs--it’s been too long. He turns from the bag jus as Matt SLAMS the book shut. They face each other. A BEAT Then Matt picks up the book. And Jack goes back to the ba Two fighters on the comeback trail. CuT TO:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Matt is using his cane in a ‘three-point tap and drag.’ H steps into the intersection just as the light turns red. taxi HONKS as Matt falls back over the curb cursing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where we see Jack taking a beating against the ropes in h first boxing match in years. It’s a long road back. " cur To:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Matt is back at his braille book. A BREEZE picks up and t SPEED BAG begins SQUEAKING on its chain. The sound is lik broken glass in his brain. Until Matt focuses all of his anger and throws his book at the bag across the roof. And nails it. He walks over to the bag. And for the first time he doesn fight the sounds that surround him--but lets them in. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: as the SQUEAKING slowly burns a silhouette through the darkness until--WHAM! Matt smiles and hits the bag again. And again. His hyperacute senses work the bag until it becomes just a streak of brown leather!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As Jack valiantly fights his way out of the corner, backi his opponent up with a flurry of his own.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Matt is back at the crosswalk. An OLD MAN steps off the c and Matt WHIPS OUT his cane to stop him--just as a bus al flattens him. The Old Man double-takes at the blind boy w smiles and continues on his way. cut TO:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Matt stands in silhouette against the stars. He slowly reaches out feeling the air around him. And as we PULL BA we reveal that we‘re on the edge of the roof... Matt does a cartwheel and the CAMERA ROLLS with him, taki us on a dizzying, vertiginous ride as Matt goes faster an faster before flipping onto TWO HEATING PIPES. He SWINGS over them like a gymnast on parallel bars befor dismounting atop a brick smokestack. Matt smiles into the night as we hear the sound of a CROWD CHEERING him on.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A sign flashes out front in bright neon lights: “LIVE! TONIGHT! JACK ‘THE DEVIL’ MURDOCK vs. JIMMY PALMIOTTI!” CuT TO:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jack is warming up. Suddenly the door opens to reveal an older man dressed in an expensive suit. FALLON. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: FALLON
dialogues.text: Jack, it’s been a while...

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: I don’t work for you no more, Fallon. Fallon chuckles.

dialogues.speaker: FALLON
dialogues.text: Jack, you never stopped. Did you really think you won those fights on your own? Wood, Mack, Chichester--they’re all my fighters. Just like you. Jack looks down as he realizes the truth.

dialogues.speaker: FALLON, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Now it’s your turn to take a fall.

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: What if I say “no?”

dialogues.speaker: FALLON
dialogues.text: You know the answer to that. You used to handle those jobs yourself. Fallon pats him on the shoulder. FALLON (CONT’D) Think about your boy, Jack. I'm sure you'll do the right thing. He steps out as we STAY ON Jack’s devastated reaction.

dialogues.speaker: THE FIGHT.
dialogues.text: Palmiotti is easily fifteen years younger and light years faster. He hits Jack with an upper-cut that drops him to canvas. Jack looks out to see Fallon in the audience.

dialogues.speaker: C'MON, DAD
dialogues.text: And then he sees his son as well. He struggles to his fee Palmiotti comes to finish him off. But in his haste he is watching for Jack’s left hook. And it’s a beauty. Palmiot is rocked as the crowd ROARS. Jack throws a brutal series combinations until--Palmiotti hits the canvas!

dialogues.speaker: RING ANNOUNCER
dialogues.text: And the winner...Battlin’ Jack Murdock! (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Jack smiles to his beaming son. But then he looks to wher Fallon and his men were sitting. They’re already gone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As Jack steps out of the back door to see a black stretch limousine waiting. He doesn’t bother trying to.run. Inste he just bows his head. And waits.

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: Go on. Get it over with.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Matt waits out front for his father when his hyperacute hearing picks up the sounds of violence. We hear the EXCI HEARTBEATS of Fallon’s men as they PUNCH and KICK and LAU The CRACK of bone gives way to the PULPY sound of spit an blood. Followed by the RASPY MOAN of his FATHER’S VOICE.

dialogues.speaker: MATT
dialogues.text: Dad...? The sounds are suddenly overwhelmed by one THUNDEROUS BAS HEARTBEAT. Then the DEATH BLOW. And the MOANING STOPS.

dialogues.speaker: DAD
dialogues.text: CcuT TO: Jack's lifeless body lying in the alley. A single red ros is dropped onto his bloodied chest. cuT TO: Matt running down the alley as Fallon’s limousine speeds him. Matt finds his father’s body and holds him in his ar He feels for his face. But it’s a stranger’s face now. MATT (cont'd) I can’t--I can’t see you... Matt SOBS as he tries to “see” his father one more time. even that has been taken from him. MATT (cont'd) I can’t see you, Dad... (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: We CRANE UP from the tragic scene until we stop on the Catholic church from our opening scene. The stained glass FACE OF MARY smiles back at us in the moonlight.

dialogues.speaker: MATT, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: Ladies and gentlemen of the jury, we have come here today to seek the truth. We have come here today to seek justice.

dialogues.speaker: CU LADY JUSTICE
dialogues.text: The statue is blindfolded, with the scales of justice in hand and a sword in the other. We PULL BACK to reveal the face of attorney MATT MURDOCK addressing a courtroom.

dialogues.speaker: MATT
dialogues.text: Lenny Bruce once said that in the halls of justice, the only justice is out in the halls. But today you can change all that. Because today you are justice. A petite but tough-looking girl is sitting beside Matt's partner, FRANKLIN “FOGGY” NELSON.

dialogues.speaker: MATT, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: The criminal case against Quesada and Smith was dismissed due to the arresting officer's failure to read the defendants their Miranda Rights. This civil suit is the victim's only recourse. (beat) But Angela Sutton doesn’t seek damages. She seeks the truth. She seeks justice. And the chance to get on with her life.

dialogues.speaker: QUESADA
dialogues.text: on the witness stand. He wears one of those moustaches th you only find on porn stars or dentists.

dialogues.speaker: MATT
dialogues.text: Mr. Quesada, would you please tell the jury the sequence of events leading up to the night of June 30th? Quesada sighs, bored with this. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: QUESADA
dialogues.text: Me and Smitty--we was the last to leave Josie's Bar that night. We slowly CLOSE ON Quesada as he continues. As he does we hear what Matt hears--the sound of his HEARTBEAT ESCALATI

dialogues.speaker: QUESADA, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Angie was closing up and asked if we wanted to stay and party after. We PUSH CLOSER until we’re right up against Quesada’s che And then we push RIGHT THROUGH to see his HEART BEATING. QUESADA (CONT’D) (V.O.) (CONT'D) A few drinks and she was good to go. Said she wanted to take us both on. The HEARTBEAT SKIPS. We suddenly PULL OUT of his chest an WHIP ACROSS the room to Matt's reaction. Busted.

dialogues.speaker: MATT
dialogues.text: Mr. Quesada, you do understand that perjury is a federal offense?

dialogues.speaker: QUESADA
dialogues.text: Hey, I know what happened.

dialogues.speaker: MATT
dialogues.text: I’m sure that you do. Foggy TAPS a stack of photos onto the table. Matt traces sound and effortlessly scoops them up on his way to the j

dialogues.speaker: MATT, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: (passing them out) These are photographs of the victim taken at Mercy Hospital that night. (back to Quesada) . I wonder, Mr. Quesada, did she ask you for the cuts and bruises as well? Quesada smiles, lecherous.

dialogues.speaker: QUESADA
dialogues.text: Trust me. She loved every minute of it. The girl softly starts to cry as Foggy awkwardly pats her shoulder. Matt has to restrain himself from throttling th creep right here on the spot. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: MATT
dialogues.text: No further questions, Your Honor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As Matt and Foggy step outside, anger and disappointment etched on their faces.

dialogues.speaker: FOGGY
dialogues.text: Look, we knew it was a risk going in--

dialogues.speaker: MATT
dialogues.text: Why? Because she’s from the Kitchen and not the Upper East Side?

dialogues.speaker: FOGGY
dialogues.text: Because she had a drug problem. Juries don’t like their victims to be flawed. They judged her past and not her case.

dialogues.speaker: MATT
dialogues.text: How is she supposed to sleep at night knowing that they‘re out there? They stop and look out to the city together.

dialogues.speaker: FOGGY
dialogues.text: (sighs) You wanna get drunk?

dialogues.speaker: MATT
dialogues.text: Yeah. But not tonight. We CLOSE ON the darkness in Matt's eyes. MATT (CONT’D) I’ve got work to do.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MUSIC UP: EVEL KNIEVEL by Ceasefire vs. The Deadly Avenge

dialogues.speaker: ON MATT
dialogues.text: He pulls his hood down over his head as we SNAP ZOOM 360 DEGREES to reveal DAREDEVIL in full costume. The body sui is DEEP CRIMSON--nearly black--and reveals every sinewy muscle of his taut frame. The boots are high-impact for optimal speed. The gloves wire-mesh for optimal damage. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CU CANE
dialogues.text: Matt hits a hidden stud and the curved end of its handle straightens. He snaps the cane apart into two sections. This is Daredevil’'s BILLY CLUB. The symbol of his handic transformed into a weapon of his abilities.

dialogues.speaker: ON DAREDEVIL
dialogues.text: LEAPING from rooftop to rooftop; his senses guiding him a the way. He suddenly SWAN DIVES off of a ledge and PLUMME TEN STORIES to the street below. He smiles as he falls. T accident took his sight. But it took his fear as well. He shoots a 50-FOOT NYLON CORD from his billy club, catch the railing of a fire escape, and SWINGS UP onto the roof JOSIE'S BAR. A murky shit-hole down near the shipyards.

dialogues.speaker: CUT TO
dialogues.text: INT. JOSIE’S BAR - NIGHT MUSIC UP: WAITING TO DIE by Planet Earth Dozens of bad asses covered in tribal tattoos and multipl piercings drift in and out of a haze of cigarette smoke. Everyone is either drunk, wired on meth, or both.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: as its raised in a toast by Quesada.

dialogues.speaker: QUESADA
dialogues.text: To the justice system! Smith laughs as they throw back their shots. QUESADA (CONT’D) Line ‘em up, Josie! I'm ready to par-ty! JOSIE, the no-nonsense owner, glares at them both.

dialogues.speaker: JOSIE
dialogues.text: You got a lotta nerve coming in here after what you did.

dialogues.speaker: SMITH
dialogues.text: Hey, it's a free country, baby.

dialogues.speaker: QUESADA
dialogues.text: We‘re proof of that. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Quesada and Smith laugh. Suddenly, we hear a ROAR as TWO BIKERS ride their Harley Davidsons right into the bar.

dialogues.speaker: JOSIE
dialogues.text: Hey hey! Bikes outside! They push their front tires up against the wall. JOSIE (cont'd) No burn-outs, you assholes! A Biker Chick lifts her shirt and they GUN THEIR ENGINES response, spinning their back tires in a burn-out contest BLACK SMOKE fills the bar as they burn rubber, their engi whining LOUDER AND LOUDER as everyone CHEERS. JOSIE (cont’d) (sighs) I shoulda opened a fuckin’ Starbucks... Suddenly, the death-metal music is cut. EIGHT by Junkie x begins as everyone turns to look. The only thing visible through the thick black smoke is a pool table light, swinging back and forth. And then... The SHADOW OF A DEVIL appears through the smoke. It slowl BEGINS TO GROW across the length of the bar.

dialogues.speaker: SMITH
dialogues.text: Holy shit. It’s him. He‘’s real.

dialogues.speaker: QUESADA
dialogues.text: (feeling no pain) Yeah. Somebody's fucked, man... Quesada downs another tequila shot before noticing that t shadow has stopped over him. Two RED EYES flicker back through the smoke, like a demon straight from hell.

dialogues.speaker: QUESADA, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: What--what do you want?

dialogues.speaker: DAREDEVIL
dialogues.text: I want to hear you say it.

dialogues.speaker: QUESADA
dialogues.text: Say what?

dialogues.speaker: DAREDEVIL
dialogues.text: That you're guilty. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Quesada looks at the guys in the bar. He feels the weight the steel strapped to his sides. He smiles. Big.

dialogues.speaker: QUESADA
dialogues.text: Okay. So I’m guilty... Quesada draws twin .45's and aims them straight at the de We TRACK THE MOB as they follow suit, whipping out a virt ARSENAL OF WEAPONRY before the shadow of the vigilante. QUESADA (CONT’D) What are you gonna do about it? We CLOSE ON Daredevil as he smiles back.

dialogues.speaker: DAREDEVIL
dialogues.text: Raise hell. And with that he LEAPS INTO THE MOB! Daredevil attacks in hybrid fighting style of martial arts mixed with street fighting. The brutal KICKS, PUNCHES, and ELBOWS come hard fast and violent. Blood SPURTS. Bones CRACK. Teeth FLY. This is not Your Friendly Neighborhood Spider-Man.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: as the lights over the billiard tables SWING BACK AND FOR in the melee. Combined with the smoke from the motorcycle burn-outs it creates a STROBE LIGHT EFFECT that confuses everyone in the bar. Everyone except for Daredevil. We watch as he lets his extraordinary senses take over...

dialogues.speaker: CLIIIICK
dialogues.text: ‘Daredevil turns as we WHIP PAN across the room and PUSH DOWN THE BARREL of a Casull .454! We see the enormous bul slide into its chamber before we WHIP BACK to Daredevil w throws his billy club in response. We TRACK THE BILLY CLU back like a scud missile as it sails just wide of the Gun

dialogues.speaker: HAH
dialogues.text: --before RICOCHETING off the wall and DRILLING him in the back of the head! It snaps back into Daredevils hand as--

dialogues.speaker: CHA-CHUNK
dialogues.text: A STEEL MAGAZINE is slammed into place. Daredevil shoots billy club up over a BEAM and uses it to RUN THE WALL as bullets fly. And there are hundreds of them. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where we see the bullets represented as STREAMS OF SOUND. They zip above him, below him, and through his legs as he conterts his body while running across the wall! The bullets chase him over to the other side of the room, DROPPING several bikers and skinheads by mistake.

dialogues.speaker: QUESADA
dialogues.text: make a break for it. They dive right through the plate gl window with a CRAAASH!

dialogues.speaker: SMASH CUT TO
dialogues.text: EXT. JOSIE‘S BAR - SAME Breathless, Quesada and Smith stop at the corner. In the colorless alley we notice a red DD has been spray-painted the wall. The local gangs have tagged this as a warning: You're entering the Devil's Neighborhood.

dialogues.speaker: QUESADA
dialogues.text: No way he’s getting outta there... Behind Quesada, a RED NYLON LOOP slips down around Smith' neck and draws tight as Smith struggles silently. QUESADA (CONT’D) (oblivious) They'll ventilate his ass. Right, Smitty? Smith is lifted half out of frame--his fat legs stop kick QUESADA (CONT’D) Smitty? He turns to see Smith hanging lifeless from the fire esca Quesada SCREAMS as he turns and runs down the alley.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Following Quesada's footsteps from on high. And then they disappear down into the cacophony of the subway station.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As Quesada trips and falls down the stairs. He struggles his feet and looks back to see... (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: THE DEVIL IS COMING.
dialogues.text: Quesada fires back wildly until the barrel CLICKS empty.

dialogues.speaker: GET AWAY
dialogues.text: Daredevil steps from the shadows. No longer with the face a hero. But with the face of a madman.

dialogues.speaker: DAREDEVIL
dialogues.text: You raped a girl. In Hell’s Kitchen. That's my neighborhood.

dialogues.speaker: QUESADA
dialogues.text: I’'11 give you whatever you want! Just say it! What do you want? Daredevil looms.

dialogues.speaker: DAREDEVIL
dialogues.text: Justice. Quesada starts to scream. But then--VROOM!--a subway trai ROARS past them on the other side of the tracks. DAREDEVIL’S POV As his hyperacute senses are OVERWHELMED; the sensory ima of his brain SHATTERED like a million shards of glass.

dialogues.speaker: SUBWAY PLATFORM
dialogues.text: Daredevil stumbles, momentarily helpless. Quesada reaches into his boot and pulls out a .38. He points the snub-nos barrel right up against Daredevil’s forehead and laughs.

dialogues.speaker: QUESADA
dialogues.text: Back to hell, diablo. But as the hammer COCKS the sound takes us back into-- DAREDEVIL’S POV As his radar returns. Suddenly, we hear the CRACK of Quesada‘s leg as Daredevil lashes out with his billy club

dialogues.speaker: AAAHHH
dialogues.text: Quesada falls back down onto the tracks, his leg bent at ugly right angle. He looks up to see Daredevil bathed in white, then turns to see the light coming around the corn (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: DAREDEVIL
dialogues.text: That tunnel of light--it’s not heaven. Quesada’s SCREAMS are cut short beneath the subway train.

dialogues.speaker: HEY YOU
dialogues.text: Daredevil turns as TWO TRANSIT COPS run toward him, drawi their guns as the subway rumbles past.

dialogues.speaker: HANDS UP
dialogues.text: Daredevil raises his hands still holding the billy club. HOOKS the end railing of the train as the cops stop in amazement to watch the figure go FLYING down the tunnel.

dialogues.speaker: CRIME SCENE TAPE
dialogues.text: Cordoning off the subway tracks. A CIGARETTE BUTT rolls I FRAME before a MAN ducks under the yellow tape. BEN URICH He wears an old Jets windbreaker over jeans and sneakers. cop Hey! You can't go past there! Urich flashes press credentials before the Cop waves him A squatty DETECTIVE MANOLIS grimaces as Urich approaches.

dialogues.speaker: DET. MANOLIS
dialogues.text: The big story’s at Josie’s tonight.

dialogues.speaker: URICH
dialogues.text: So what are you doing here, Nick? Manolis glares as Urich lights up another unfiltered Came

dialogues.speaker: DET. MANOLIS
dialogues.text: You‘re wasting your time, Urich. There’s nothing to see here. Urich glances over in time to see Quesada’s face being covered with a white sheet.

dialogues.speaker: URICH
dialogues.text: Jose Quesada... As they carry him past we see it’s only his torso. A seco stretcher follows with the lower half of his body. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: URICH, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: ..-and the rest of Jose Quesada. That’s a whole lot of nothing, Nick. : Manolis scowls as we EXT, MATT’S APARTMENT - NIGHT A worn brownstone in Hell’s Kitchen. We see the silent shadow of a devil slipping through a rooftop skylight. cuT TO:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Matt strips off his costume to reveal the SCARS that cros his body, like some kind of flesh-toned, patchwork quilt. Badges of honor from the street wars of the past.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The apartment is as spare as a monastery. One couch. One chair. No coffee tables or lamps to bump into. No paintin or photographs to admire. Just one large BAS RELIEF on th wall; a tangle of ANGELS and DEVILS. Tactile art.

dialogues.speaker: IN THE KITCHEN
dialogues.text: Where we see Matt's Answering machine blinking. He presse one of the BRAILLE BUTTONS before turning to the sink. BE

dialogues.speaker: WOMAN'S VOICE
dialogues.text: Matt, it’s Heather.

dialogues.speaker: ON MATT
dialogues.text: wincing at the cut on his cheek. Or maybe her voice.

dialogues.speaker: WOMAN'S VOICE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Are you there? (sighs) Of course you’re not there. You're never there. At least not for me. Matt leans over the sink as blood drips from his cheek. H turns on the sink and drowns his head under the water. WOMAN'S VOICE (CONT‘D) I didn’t want to do this over the phone. But it’s not like you give me a choice. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: As blood swirls down the drain we realize this is the sam ritual he had as a boy. The bleeding just got heavier. WOMAN’S VOICE (CONT’D) I mean--it'’s been three months now and I’ve never even seen your apartment. Matt opens a cabinet to reveal bottles of disinfectants, aids, gauze, and Peroxide--the real world result of putti your body on the line night after night. He dabs Peroxide onto his cut cheek before swabbing it in orange Betadine. WOMAN’S VOICE (CONT’D) Every time we sleep together I wake up in the morning alone. He opens another cabinet to reveal a pharmacy of painkill WOMAN’S VOICE (CONT’D) I mean, Jesus, where do you go at three o’clock in the morning? Matt pushes aside the Tylenol, then the Demerol, before grabbing the Vicodin. WOMAN’S VOICE (CONT‘D) I thought that if I was patient enough you'd let me in. That we'd take our relationship to the next level. He pops two Vicodin and chews them into a sour white powd WOMAN’S VOICE (CONT’D) Then I realized...this is the next level. Matt slides open a third drawer to reveal a white bag ful Epsom Salts. He scoops up a handful and steps into... THE LIVING ROOM. He stops before what appears to be a coffin. But then he opens the lid to reveal it’s a FLOATATION TANK. He drops Epsom Salts into the tank and strips off his costume. WOMAN’S VOICE (CONT’D) Good-bye, Matt. I hope you find whatever it is you‘re looking for. CLICK. Matt slides into the warm water and closes his eyes. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: MATT
dialogues.text: ‘Bye, Heather. A brief moment of silence. But then we hear the gradual r of voices from his neighborhood:

dialogues.speaker: VOICE
dialogues.text: We’ve got a caucasian, female, with a gunshot wound to the chest--

dialogues.speaker: VOICE
dialogues.text: Suspect is in custody. Cordoza, Vincent. En route to Precinct Six--

dialogues.speaker: VOICE
dialogues.text: E.M.T.'s on the scene, request police escort to Mercy Hospital--

dialogues.speaker: VOICE
dialogues.text: Cancel that escort. Victim has expired. Repeat, victim has-- Matt CLOSES the door of the tank. And only now, with his sensitive skin relieved of touch, his hyperacute hearing deadened to sound, can he finally find peace, — FADE OUT.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A giant gold Buddha dominates the super chic restaurant.

dialogues.speaker: FISK, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: I'm so glad we've found this time to sit down together, Mr. Urich. We PULL BACK from the Buddha to reveal a MASSIVE MAN sitt across the table from the reporter. WILSON FISK. Six~foot-seven and 450 pounds. He looks more like Buddah than Buddah does. But what some may mistake for obesity i actually grotesquely over-developed muscle. At Fisk’s side (always at his side) sits his diminutive assistant, WESLEY, while TWO BODYGUARDS stand watch at th door. Urich watches as Fisk's huge hands gracefully work pair of chopsticks over a giant plate of sushi. —, (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: URICH .
dialogues.text: I've been trying to get an interview for over a year, Mr. Fisk. Why now?

dialogues.speaker: FISK
dialogues.text: I'm well aware of the value of publicity. Even from a paper such as yours.

dialogues.speaker: URICH
dialogues.text: Or maybe one of your companies is going public--say your spice business--and you want some spin before it does? Fisk smiles. He‘’s good. .

dialogues.speaker: FISK
dialogues.text: Of course, I can’t confirm that or I'd be violating federal trade law.

dialogues.speaker: URICH
dialogues.text: Of course. It’s a long way from the old neighborhood. Isn’t it, Mr. Fisk?

dialogues.speaker: FISK
dialogues.text: You can take the boy out of the Bronx, but you can never take the Bronx out of the boy. My net worth may now be north of ten billion dollars, but I still believe that a little dirt on a man’s hands is a sign of success.

dialogues.speaker: URICH
dialogues.text: Let‘s talk about the dirt. Fisk chuckles.

dialogues.speaker: URICH, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Have you ever heard of the Kingpin? Fisk's smile fades slightly.

dialogues.speaker: FISK
dialogues.text: Of course. My father used to tell me stories about the Kingpin when I was a child. How one man ruled all of the crime in New York City. Preposterous. Wesley nods, echoing his words: “preposterous.”

dialogues.speaker: URICH
dialogues.text: Maybe. Or maybe not. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: FISK
dialogues.text: Of course, you're the one who writes about the Devil of Hell’s Kitchen. What is it that you call him again?

dialogues.speaker: URICH
dialogues.text: ‘Daredevil.‘

dialogues.speaker: FISK
dialogues.text: ‘Daredevil.’ I wonder why the New York Times hasn't picked up on it yet?

dialogues.speaker: URICH
dialogues.text: Maybe they don’t like being scooped.

dialogues.speaker: FISK
dialogues.text: Yes, I’m sure that’s it. Fisk smiles condescendingly as Urich returns to his notes

dialogues.speaker: URICH
dialogues.text: -I understand that you‘ve been buying up the harbor through several different holding companies.

dialogues.speaker: FISK
dialogues.text: You obviously have me mistaken for Nikolas Natchios, the shipping tycoon. (grins) Now there’s a powerful man.

dialogues.speaker: URICH
dialogues.text: I have a source that says Natchios is only a soldier for the Kingpin.

dialogues.speaker: FISK
dialogues.text: Your very own ‘Deep Throat.’ How exciting for you, Mr. Urich. You‘’ll have to let me know how it ends up.

dialogues.speaker: URICH
dialogues.text: I will. Fisk extends a bowl of fish.

dialogues.speaker: FISK
dialogues.text: Now try the kimchi, it's to die for. Wesley mouths the words: “to-die-for.”  25.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fisk steps into his stretch limousine with Wesley and the Bodyguards in tow. Urich lights up another Camel as he watches them drive off, shrouded behind tinted windows. cuT TO:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where the two massive Bodyguards sit facing Fisk and Wesl in the back of the limousine.

dialogues.speaker: FISK
dialogues.text: Someone’s been talking.

dialogues.speaker: WESLEY
dialogues.text: That’s impossible. The only ones who know anything are Natchios and us.

dialogues.speaker: FISK
dialogues.text: This source of Urich’s would have to be either very foolish or very weak. And Natchios is neither. Fisk runs his fingers over the heavy crystal end of his c

dialogues.speaker: FISK, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: You know, Wesley, in ancient times you'd cut your bodyguard’s tongue off his first day on the job... ' Fisk suddenly BRAINS Bodyguard #1 with his cane! BLOOD SPLATTERS across the tinted windows as Wesley SCREAMS. Bodyguard #2 reacts. But not quick enough. Fisk CLUTCHES his windpipe with one massive paw and SNAPS his neck in t And then it’s over. Two men dead. In a matter of seconds.

dialogues.speaker: FISK, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Handkerchief. Wesley hands a handkerchief to Fisk who calmly wipes off crystal setting on his cane. FISK (CONT’D) Now, when does our friend Natchios get back into town? Wesley can’t take his eyes off of the corpses. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: WESLEY
dialogues.text: Tomorrow. Noon. Fisk glances at his reflection in the window.

dialogues.speaker: FISK
dialogues.text: If the press wants a Kingpin, I'll give them a Kingpin. On a silver platter. He lights a Cuban cigar. FISK (CONT’D) Get me Bullseye.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MUSIC UP: MEET THE CREEPER by Rob Zombie As the racehorses are released from their starting gates.

dialogues.speaker: TRACK ANNOUNCER, (V.0O.)
dialogues.text: ...and Gimme Some Sugar jumps into the lead...it‘s Gimme Some Sugar followed by King Kirby and Excelsior... Amongst the CACOPHONY OF NOISE we single out a MAN sittin close to the track. He wears a long, blue leather coat an his head is shorn clean like a bullet. CAMERA SLOWLY SWIN AROUND HIM to reveal the TATTOO on the back of his head. A BULL’S-EYE.

dialogues.speaker: TRACK ANNOUNCER, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: It‘s Gimme Some Sugar and Excelsior... Gimme Some Sugar and Excelsior rounding the corner with King Kirby in third...

dialogues.speaker: VOICE
dialogues.text: Bang! Bang! Bullseye turns to see a LITTLE BOY sitting beside him. He wears a cowboy hat and shoots at the horses with a cap gu

dialogues.speaker: LITTLE BOY
dialogues.text: My Dad let me bet five dollars! I picked the black one with the spot on his nose!

dialogues.speaker: BULLSEYE
dialogues.text: You don’t say? (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: TRACK ANNOUNCER, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: It's Gimme Some Sugar pulling ahead... Gimme Some Sugar and Excelsior... A WAITRESS steps over with a glass of wine. And as she se it down Bullseye reaches over and “accidentally” knocks i off the table. The wine glass SHATTERS as red Cabernet bleeds across the white cement floor.

dialogues.speaker: WAITRESS
dialogues.text: Oh dear. I'11 be right back to clean that up for you... And as she turns to leave Bullseye holds up the STEM OF T BROKEN WINE GLASS; it's jagged end is as sharp as a knife He looks over to the Boy and holds his finger to his lips

dialogues.speaker: TRACK ANNOUNCER, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: Its Gimme Some Sugar by a length! Gimme Some Sugar heading for the stretch! Bullseye suddenly spins and WHIPS the glass stem out into track piercing the neck of the lead Jockey! The Jockey fa to the track where he’s TRAMPLED by the other horses!

dialogues.speaker: TRACK ANNOUNCER, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: OH MY! Gimme Some Sugar’s jockey is down! A jockey is down! And now it’s Excelsior at the finish! Paramedics rush to the rider as Excelsior crosses the fin line. It’s the black one with the spot on his nose.

dialogues.speaker: TRACK ANNOUNCER, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: It’s Excelsior followed by King Kirby in second and Saving Grace in third! Bullseye smiles back at the Little Boy.

dialogues.speaker: BULLSEYE
dialogues.text: Looks like your lucky day. He winks and “shoots” back at the Little Boy with his fin as his PAGER goes off. He checks the message before turni and disappearing into the crowd. CcuT TO:  28.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A photo of Josie’s with the headline: BARROOM BLITZ-KRIEG Below that, in much smaller letters, with the photo of a girl named LISA TaAZIO.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As we reveal Foggy and Matt sitting with their morning coffee. Foggy reads Matt the story:

dialogues.speaker: FOGGY
dialogues.text: ‘...police are still investigating.’ (looks up) I bet they are. Check this out. (reading) ‘Witnesses say Quesada and Smith were singled out by the demonic vigilante known as Daredevil.’

dialogues.speaker: MATT
dialogues.text: Here we go again...

dialogues.speaker: FOGGY
dialogues.text: Wait, it gets better. (reading) ‘A policeman on the scene reports that the suspect flew’--got that?--‘flew down the subway tunnel to make his escape.'

dialogues.speaker: MATT
dialogues.text: It’s the Post, Foggy. That’s one step up from the National Enquirer.

dialogues.speaker: FOGGY
dialogues.text: There must be something to these stories. We've been hearing them for years.

dialogues.speaker: MATT
dialogues.text: Yeah, like the alligators that live in the sewers.

dialogues.speaker: FOGGY
dialogues.text: That's true about the alligators. I’m serious. I got a friend in sanitation. Foggy smiles at an artist’s rendering of Daredevil. It lo like something out of H.R. Geiger. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: FOGGY (cont'd) I don’t know what scares me more--that the Devil has come to New York or that some nut job is dressing up ina Halloween costume to fight crime. (chuckles) I’d hate to see that guy’s therapy bills.

dialogues.speaker: MATT
dialogues.text: (smile fading) Yeah...

dialogues.speaker: FOGGY
dialogues.text: Speaking of bills, we got our first payment from Mr. Lee this morning. Matt knows what's coming and tries to change the subject.

dialogues.speaker: MATT
dialogues.text: Great. Could you pass the sugar? Foggy unscrews the lid on the SALT SHAKER and slides it o

dialogues.speaker: FOGGY
dialogues.text: Actually, it’ not great. He paid us in fluke. That's a fish, Matt. Did you know that? Because I sure didn’t.

dialogues.speaker: MATT
dialogues.text: He goes fishing on weekends.

dialogues.speaker: FOGGY
dialogues.text: And I go salsa dancing. But you don’t see me offering to dance for my bills.

dialogues.speaker: MATT
dialogues.text: And a grateful city thanks you. Matt pours the salt into his coffee.

dialogues.speaker: FOGGY
dialogues.text: We can’t keep taking these pro bono cases. We need better clients. Foggy squirts ketchup into the creamer.

dialogues.speaker: MATT
dialogues.text: Define “better.”

dialogues.speaker: FOGGY
dialogues.text: Guilty rich people. Cream? (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: MATT
dialogues.text: {taking it) Remember what we talked about in college? How we wanted to make a difference?

dialogues.speaker: FOGGY
dialogues.text: I remember. I just thought that we would’ve sold out by now. Matt pours the ketchup/creamer into his salted coffee. Bu before he drinks it he suddenly turns and SNIFFS the air.

dialogues.speaker: MATT
dialogues.text: Mmmm... Foggy’s seen this before.

dialogues.speaker: FOGGY
dialogues.text: Where-where-where?

dialogues.speaker: MATT
dialogues.text: Behind you. Foggy looks over his shoulder to see... ELEKTRA NATCHIOS. An exotic beauty with a wild mane of black hair. Her body equal parts muscle and sensuality. And although she’s dressed casually (low-slung hip-huggers, baby doll t-shir belly ring) she still has the aura of privilege about her

dialogues.speaker: MATT, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Tell me.

dialogues.speaker: FOGGY
dialogues.text: You want the truth?

dialogues.speaker: MATT
dialogues.text: And nothing but.

dialogues.speaker: FOGGY
dialogues.text: She's hideous. Matt grins. He knows Foggy’s lying, of course. Foggy pick up a spoon and uses it to check his reflection. And as he does Matt deftly swi i . FOGGY (cont'd) As your attorney in this matter I must advise against any further action. Foggy puts the spoon down to see--Matt’s already gone. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: ON MATT
dialogues.text: using his cane like a normal blind man as he steps across cafe. He ‘accidentally’ bumps into Elektra‘s table.

dialogues.speaker: MATT
dialogues.text: Excuse me. Elektra never looks up from her Village Voice.

dialogues.speaker: ELEKTRA
dialogues.text: Sure.

dialogues.speaker: MATT
dialogues.text: Seems every time I get the lay of the land here they rearrange the furniture.

dialogues.speaker: MATT
dialogues.text: I was looking for some sugar.

dialogues.speaker: ELEKTRA
dialogues.text: Right in front of you.

dialogues.speaker: MATT
dialogues.text: Could you be more specific?

dialogues.speaker: ELEKTRA
dialogues.text: What are you--? And then she looks up and freezes.

dialogues.speaker: MATT
dialogues.text: (helpfully) ‘Blind?’

dialogues.speaker: ELEKTRA
dialogues.text: Oh! Oh, I‘m so sorry I...here... She holds up the sugar and places it in his hands. And as she does Matt touches her hand and smiles.

dialogues.speaker: MATT
dialogues.text: Funny. I can’t tell where the sugar ends and you begin. A LONG BEAT as Elektra looks him over.

dialogues.speaker: ELEKTRA
dialogues.text: Does that line actually work for you? (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Foggy CHUCKLES before sipping his coffee--and BLOWING IT across the table! Matt bites his lip to keep from laughin ELEKTRA (CONT’D) (glancing over) Friend of yours?

dialogues.speaker: MATT
dialogues.text: Never seen him before. She finally laughs.

dialogues.speaker: MATT, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: (offering his hand) Matt Murdock. (taking it) Nice to meet you, Matt Murdock. And then she gets up and starts for the door.

dialogues.speaker: MATT
dialogues.text: Wait. I didn’t get your name. She glances back.

dialogues.speaker: ELEKTRA
dialogues.text: That's because I didn't give it. She walks out of the coffee shop as Foggy hoots:

dialogues.speaker: DE-NIED
dialogues.text: Matt smiles ruefully. And then he grabs his cane.

dialogues.speaker: FOGGY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Hey...where you going?

dialogues.speaker: MATT
dialogues.text: To file an appeal.

dialogues.speaker: FOGGY
dialogues.text: We have to be at the courthouse at twelve o’clock. I'm not going to wait for you.

dialogues.speaker: MATT
dialogues.text: I‘1l be there.

dialogues.speaker: FOGGY
dialogues.text: Twelve o’clock! (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: He walks out the door as Foggy shakes his head.

dialogues.speaker: FOGGY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Poor guy doesn’t have a clue... And then he absent-mindedly sips his coffee--and BLOWS IT across the table for the second time as we CuT TO:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As Matt tracks Elektra’s scent through the park. He walks past a large oak tree as a BREEZE RUSTLES through the lea momentarily scattering the trail when:

dialogues.speaker: ELEKTRA, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: What do you want?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: as Matt whirls around to reveal Elektra with her arms crossed. She looks pissed.

dialogues.speaker: MATT
dialogues.text: I just wanted to know your name.

dialogues.speaker: ELEKTRA
dialogues.text: I don’t like being followed. So don’t. She turns to leave. Matt reaches for her arm. Bad idea.

dialogues.speaker: MATT
dialogues.text: Hey wait-- She expertly SNATCHES his wrist in a Kenpo lock.

dialogues.speaker: ELERTRA
dialogues.text: And I don’t like being touched.

dialogues.speaker: MATT
dialogues.text: Why don’t you tell me what you do like and we'll start from there? Matt suddenly collapses her hold and reverses their hands into a classic Wuxia guard. Elektra reacts, surprised.

dialogues.speaker: ELEKTRA
dialogues.text: How did you do that?

dialogues.speaker: MATT
dialogues.text: Ancient Chinese secret. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: She offers a little smile and deflects his guard before lashing out with an iron claw. Matt cross-blocks it.

dialogues.speaker: MATT, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: That’s a shao-lin technique.

dialogues.speaker: ELEKTRA
dialogues.text: So is this. She backs him up with a succession of STRIKES AND LUNGES. Her style is graceful and deadly; ballet meets Kung Fu.

dialogues.speaker: MATT
dialogues.text: (sensing) You're holding back...

dialogues.speaker: ELEKTRA
dialogues.text: Yes.

dialogues.speaker: MATT
dialogues.text: Don’t. She ups the attack. They circle each other as a HOMELESS stops to watch this bizarre show.

dialogues.speaker: ELEKTRA
dialogues.text: What are you? A sensei?

dialogues.speaker: MATT
dialogues.text: Nope. A lawyer.

dialogues.speaker: HOMELESS MAN
dialogues.text: Kick his ass! Elektra laughs and doubles-up her attack. The fight is ‘growing more intense--but also more playful. Sexual even They sense each other’s every move--like fighting a mirro

dialogues.speaker: MATT
dialogues.text: All this just to get your name?

dialogues.speaker: ELEKTRA
dialogues.text: Try asking for my number. She drives Matt back until he PUSHES OFF a park bench and wraps her arms. He‘’s got her beat. And she knows it.

dialogues.speaker: ELEKTRA, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I never fall for the same move twice.

dialogues.speaker: MATT
dialogues.text: I‘11 remember that. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: He releases her. Elektra finally offers her hand.

dialogues.speaker: ELEKTRA
dialogues.text: Elektra Natchios. Matt takes it. In a split-second she FLIPS HIM to the gro and holds a two-fingered strike to his windpipe. A BEAT.

dialogues.speaker: MATT
dialogues.text: So can I call you? She smiles. And then she starts to laugh as we CuT TO: Matt and Elektra walking through the park together.

dialogues.speaker: MATT, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Who did you train with?

dialogues.speaker: ELEKTRA
dialogues.text: It was always changing. My father had me study with a different sensei every year since I was five years old.

dialogues.speaker: MATT
dialogues.text: Sounds like he wanted to turn you into some kind of warrior.

dialogues.speaker: ELEKTRA
dialogues.text: No. Just not a victim. (changing the subject) What about you? How does a blind man learn to fight like that?

dialogues.speaker: MATT
dialogues.text: (a la “Karate Kid”) “Wax on...wax off...” She laughs and punches him in the arm as Matt winces. Dam she's strong. We hear a car horn HONKING as she turns to a black limousine pulling up along the road. She SIGHS.

dialogues.speaker: ELEKTRA
dialogues.text: He always finds me.

dialogues.speaker: MATT
dialogues.text: Who?

dialogues.speaker: ELEKTRA
dialogues.text: Stavros. I thought I lost him at the cafe. But I swear he’s part bloodhound. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: A BIG GREEK steps out of the limousine.

dialogues.speaker: STAVROS
dialogues.text: (pointing to his watch) Pame, Elektra.

dialogues.speaker: ELEKTRA
dialogues.text: (muttering) Malakas.

dialogues.speaker: MATT
dialogues.text: Little help for the blind guy? Elektra laughs.

dialogues.speaker: ELEKTRA
dialogues.text: Stavros is my bodyguard.

dialogues.speaker: MATT
dialogues.text: You need a bodyguard?

dialogues.speaker: ELEKTRA
dialogues.text: My father can be a little over- protective at times. ~

dialogues.speaker: MATT
dialogues.text: (realizing) Natchios as in Nikolas Natchios?

dialogues.speaker: ELEKTRA
dialogues.text: That’s Dad. The horn HONKS again. ELERTRA (CONT’D) I really do have to go.

dialogues.speaker: MATT
dialogues.text: How will I find you if you won't give me your number?

dialogues.speaker: ELEKTRA
dialogues.text: You won’t. She leans over and kisses Matt's cheek. ELEKTRA (CONT‘D) I‘ll find you. She walks off as we CLOSE ON Matt’s smile. But then he -_ reaches for his wristwatch and flips up the glass lid. He feels the BRAILLE FACE and winces. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Shit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As WE TRACK Matt and Foggy down the hallway together...

dialogues.speaker: . FOGGY
dialogues.text: ‘Don’t be late.’ Those were my last words...

dialogues.speaker: MATT
dialogues.text: I’m sorry.

dialogues.speaker: FOGGY
dialogues.text: I told you I wouldn’t wait.

dialogues.speaker: MATT
dialogues.text: But you did wait.

dialogues.speaker: FOGGY
dialogues.text: Wha--that’s not the point.

dialogues.speaker: MATT
dialogues.text: I said I was sorry. What do you want?

dialogues.speaker: FOGGY
dialogues.text: Details. You owe me that.

dialogues.speaker: MATT
dialogues.text: Her name is Elektra Natchios.

dialogues.speaker: FOGGY
dialogues.text: Sounds like a Mexican appetizer.

dialogues.speaker: MATT
dialogues.text: It’s Greek, Brainiac. Her father’s Nikolas Natchios, the shipping heir.

dialogues.speaker: FOGGY
dialogues.text: And I’m Ted Kennedy’s love child.

dialogues.speaker: MATT
dialogues.text: That explains a lot, actually.

dialogues.speaker: FOGGY
dialogues.text: You: know, you’re pretty funny for a blind guy...
Where VINCENT CORDOZA is handcuffed to a ringlet on the w Tattoos on his neck, his knuckles, a jail yard stare. He looks up as the doors opens and Matt and Foggy step insid

dialogues.speaker: CORDOZA
dialogues.text: The hell are you?

dialogues.speaker: MATT
dialogues.text: We're your lawyers. If you're innocent. (beat) So are you? Innocent? We slowly CLOSE ON Cordoza as Matt listens in...

dialogues.speaker: CORDOZA
dialogues.text: Hell ya... We PUSH THROUGH his chest to reveal his HEART BEATING. unlike with Quesada, his heart is rock steady.

dialogues.speaker: CORDOZA, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: Hell ya... We PULL OUT and WHIP PAN to Matt’s reaction.

dialogues.speaker: MATT
dialogues.text: I believe you.

dialogues.speaker: CORDOZA
dialogues.text: (surprised) You do?

dialogues.speaker: FOGGY
dialogues.text: You do? Matt offers his hand out to Cordoza.

dialogues.speaker: MATT
dialogues.text: You‘ve got yourself a defense. Foggy buries his face in his hands as we And

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Amidst the pedestrian traffic we find Foggy and Matt walk down the sidewalk together holding Styrofoam cups of coff (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: FOGGY
dialogues.text: I wonder what Cordoza will pay us in? Free tattoos? Malt liquor?

dialogues.speaker: MATT
dialogues.text: Foggy...

dialogues.speaker: FOGGY
dialogues.text: He’s a three-time loser that was found holding the murder weapon a block away.

dialogues.speaker: MATT
dialogues.text: He’s also innocent.

dialogues.speaker: FOGGY
dialogues.text: How can you be so sure?

dialogues.speaker: MATT
dialogues.text: Have I ever been wrong?

dialogues.speaker: FOGGY
dialogues.text: ...no. Which is really annoying, by the way. Foggy stops and checks his clipboard. FOGGY (CONT’D) Okay. We're here. Lisa Tazio’s apartment . They stop before a small walk~up next to a Korean mini-ma

dialogues.speaker: MATT
dialogues.text: What was Tazio doing out here at one o'clock in the morning?

dialogues.speaker: FOGGY
dialogues.text: (checking his notes) Coming home from night class.

dialogues.speaker: MATT
dialogues.text: At one o'clock in the morning?

dialogues.speaker: FOGGY
dialogues.text: So it was a late night class. Look, I know you‘ve got this built-in bullshit detector, but this time it’s on the blink. I mean, why would somebody go to all this trouble just to cover-up the murder of a college girl? (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: MATT
dialogues.text: We can’t answer that until we find out more about Lisa Tazio.

dialogues.speaker: FOGGY
dialogues.text: I don't like the sound of this... INT. LISA TAZIO’S APARTMENT - NIGHT CLICK. Matt picks the lock as they step inside.

dialogues.speaker: FOGGY
dialogues.text: I must've been sick the day they taught that. Real estate law, right?

dialogues.speaker: MATT
dialogues.text: What do you see?

dialogues.speaker: FOGGY
dialogues.text: Small, bachelorette apartment. Nice kitchen. Fireplace. Exposed brick. You think they’ve already rented this place?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Foggy.

dialogues.speaker: FOGGY
dialogues.text: What? I might as well get something out of this case. (looking around) College textbooks. Diet Coke. Lots of Diet Coke. Computer. Village Voice. A college student, like the report said. Matt inhales the room.

dialogues.speaker: MATT
dialogues.text: Ammonia. Someone cleaned this place out. He stops at the desk and feels the computer.

dialogues.speaker: FOGGY
dialogues.text: Want me to turn it on?

dialogues.speaker: MATT
dialogues.text: Don’t bother. I‘m sure everything's already been erased. Matt places his hands over the pine desktop. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: FOGGY
dialogues.text: There's nothing there, Matt.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: as Matt’s finger pads touch the surface of the desk. They brush over the slightest indentation in the wood.

dialogues.speaker: MATT
dialogues.text: Give me some paper. And a marker. Foggy takes both from his clipboard and hands them over.

dialogues.speaker: FOGGY
dialogues.text: What are you doing?

dialogues.speaker: MATT
dialogues.text: She wrote a note with a ball point pen. The impression is still in the wood. Matt lays the paper over the desk and runs the marker ove it. Like magic, the marker shades everything except for t indented letters: MARK WELCH 6301000.

dialogues.speaker: MATT, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: What do we got?

dialogues.speaker: FOGGY
dialogues.text: (smiling) A name and a phone number. Suddenly the TELEPHONE RINGS. They look to each other.

dialogues.speaker: FOGGY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: You gonna get that? Matt smirks. The answering machine picks up:

dialogues.speaker: LISA TAZIO VOICE MESSAGE
dialogues.text: Hi, this is Sexy Sadie...

dialogues.speaker: FOGGY
dialogues.text: Oh Jesus. We broke into the wrong house--

dialogues.speaker: MATT
dialogues.text: Shhh.

dialogues.speaker: LISA TAZIO VOICE MESSAGE
dialogues.text: --if you want to help me study, leave your name and number at the beep. I'11 help you straighten out your Longfellow. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: MAN'S VOICE
dialogues.text: Hi, um, I saw your ad in the paper and I'd like to make an...appointment. I’m at 328-1020. Um, bye. Matt feels a button on the answering machine and presses while Foggy grabs the Village Voice and rifles through it BEEP. SECOND MAN’S VOICE Sexy Sadie, it’s your favorite professor. I’m staying at the Plaza. How’s tomorrow after midnight? Bring the ruler.

dialogues.speaker: FOGGY
dialogues.text: Check this out... CU VILLAGE VOICE CLASSIFIEDS. A shot of a sexy girl busting out of a sorority sweater i one of those call girl ads in the back. It’s Lisa Tazio.

dialogues.speaker: FOGGY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: College girl by day, call girl by night.

dialogues.speaker: MATT
dialogues.text: Lisa Tazio wasn’t coming home at one e’clock in the morning.

dialogues.speaker: FOGGY
dialogues.text: (catching on) She was going out...

dialogues.speaker: MATT
dialogues.text: And somebody was waiting. We CLOSE ON the desk top: MARK WELCH 6301000.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A CIGARETTE BUTT is flicked onto the sidewalk. We follow wisp of smoke up to the face of... BEN URICH. He drives off down the street. And as goes we TILT UP to the lights of an AIRPLANE flying overhead.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where we meet a SWEET OLD LADY flying to New York. She’s knitting while she talks. And talks. And talks...

dialogues.speaker: SWEET OLD LADY
dialogues.text: ..-and then my daughter, Susie, not the Susie from Buffalo--that’s my son Larry's daughter from his first marriage, eloped with a semi-colored fellah from Long Island. What's that word? Mulatta? Let's just say he’s got a little cream in his coffee. Anyhow he does very well for himself on that internet. Don’t ask me to explain. They got me a computer last year for Christmas but I won't use it because I'm afraid it'll start a fire... The CAMERA slowly PULLS BACK to reveal...

dialogues.speaker: BULLSEYE
dialogues.text: sitting in the seat next to her. He’s listening to Korn's TWIST on his Walkman. BULLSEYE’S POV The old lady’s lips move as the sound of DEATH METAL come out of her mouth. He finally takes the headphones out.

dialogues.speaker: SWEET OLD LADY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: ...and do you know what she said to me?

dialogues.speaker: BULLSEYE
dialogues.text: Would-you-shut-the-fuck-up?

dialogues.speaker: SWEET OLD LADY
dialogues.text: (without blinking) No, she said: “Come and visit, Mom.” But who can afford to fly these days? Bullseye puts his headphones back on as a flight attendan walks by and drops a bag of airline peanuts onto his tray Bullseye opens the tiny bag and three peanuts total roll SWEET OLD LADY (cont’d) But then my sister Florence called from St. Paul...

dialogues.speaker: CU PEANUT
dialogues.text: as Bullseye rolls it under his forefinger on the tray... (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: SWEET OLD LADY (cont’d) ...and she said she has frequent flier miles that she can’t use on account of her sciatic nerve acting up-- And then he FLICKS it into the seat before him. The peanu RICOCHETS off of the seat and INTO the Old Lady’s mouth! SWEET OLD LADY (cont‘d) ..-and I said--ACCCCKK! The old lady CHOKES on the peanut, until nothing comes ou her mouth except for an empty GASP. Buliseye watches as h eyes bulge out in horror--until she finally collapses bac into her chair. A BEAT. The Flight Attendant comes by and sets a blanket onto the ‘sleeping’ old lady's lap.

dialogues.speaker: FLIGHT ATTENDANT
dialogues.text: Can I get you anything before we land? Bullseye smiles.

dialogues.speaker: BULLSEYE
dialogues.text: More peanuts?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CLOSE-UP Matt as he addresses the jury:

dialogues.speaker: MATT
dialogues.text: Ladies and gentlemen of the jury, I’m not going to tell you that vincent Cordoza is a model citizen. He’s been in and out of reform schools and prisons since he was twelve years old, But this isn’t a court of character--it’s a court of law. And in this case Vincent Cordoza is innocent.

dialogues.speaker: ON THE JURY
dialogues.text: All of whom appear ill-at-ease. And as we PULL BACK into courtroom we see why: Matt is facing the wrong way.

dialogues.speaker: ON CORDOZA
dialogues.text: as he whispers to Foggy:

dialogues.speaker: CORDOZA
dialogues.text: He‘s facing the wrong way. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: FOGGY .
dialogues.text: Don't worry. Matt’s got ‘em right where he wants ‘em.

dialogues.speaker: CORDOZA
dialogues.text: Right...

dialogues.speaker: ON MATT
dialogues.text: as she suddenly stops and turns back to the jury.

dialogues.speaker: MATT
dialogues.text: Just kidding. The jury LAUGHS. They love him. But not the no-nonsense JUDGE. She’s clearly seen this trick of his before.

dialogues.speaker: JUDGE
dialogues.text: Does this defense come with a two-drink minimum, Mr. Murdock?

dialogues.speaker: MATT
dialogues.text: No Your Honor. I just wanted to show the jury what it's been like for Vincent Cordoza. Like talking to a wall. Matt steps before the jury as he concludes:

dialogues.speaker: MATT, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: But today his story will be heard. Today the truth comes out. And with your help, justice will be found. Thank you. Foggy steps over to help guide Matt back to his seat. May overkill, but the jury doesn’t know that.

dialogues.speaker: OFFICER POLLINA
dialogues.text: On the witness stand. He’s clean-cut, honest-looking, as answers the Prosecutor's questions:

dialogues.speaker: POLLINA
dialogues.text: We were a block away when we got the call of shots being fired. When we arrived on the scene Miss Tazio was lying dead on the steps of her apartment. We found Cordoza in the alley, incoherent, and still holding the murder weapon... Foggy sighs. This is not going to be easy. He glances to the back of the courtroom. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: FOGGY
dialogues.text: Wonder what he’s doing here?

dialogues.speaker: MATT
dialogues.text: Who?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: to reveal Ben Urich sitting down. Watching the trial..

dialogues.speaker: FOGGY
dialogues.text: That Daredevil reporter from the Post. Now it’s Matt’s turn to look rattled...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Matt steps down the sidewalk for home when we hear FOOTST behind him. The footsteps GROW CLOSER. He turns the corne towards his apartment. Tenses as the footsteps follow. Bu then he catches an intoxicating scent and stops.

dialogues.speaker: MATT
dialogues.text: Does this mean you want a re-match? The CAMERA PULLS BACK to reveal...

dialogues.speaker: ELEKTRA
dialogues.text: standing behind him on the sidewalk.

dialogues.speaker: ELEKTRA
dialogues.text: How did you know I wasn’t a mugger?

dialogues.speaker: MATT
dialogues.text: Muggers don’t smell like Chanel No. 5. She smiles.

dialogues.speaker: ELEKTRA
dialogues.text: I was in the neighborhood.

dialogues.speaker: MATT
dialogues.text: On purpose? Elektra LAUGHS.

dialogues.speaker: ELEKTRA
dialogues.text: I told you I'd find you...

dialogues.speaker: CUT TO
dialogues.text: (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: MATT AND ELEKTRA
dialogues.text: walking through the sidewalks of the Kitchen at night, sharing a slice of real New York pizza. ELEKTRA (CONT’D) I've died and gone to heaven...

dialogues.speaker: MATT
dialogues.text: Yeah. Thank God there are still some places where you can’t find a Pizza Hut.

dialogues.speaker: ELEKTRA
dialogues.text: You really love it here, don’t you? Matt smiles and nods.

dialogues.speaker: MATT
dialogues.text: The Kitchen’s like family. Sometimes it’s the Manson Family-- She laughs. : MATT (CONT’D) Co --but we all look out for each other. Watch your step here... She takes his arm as they walk around an open sewer grate ‘ ELEKTRA Thanks, I didn’t see-- (she stops, reacts) ' How do you do that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: After you take a few headers onto the sidewalk you tend to remember where the ' hazards are. Elektra smiles as she breathes in the night. We notice sh \ still hasn't let go of his arm. Matt notices too. Smile i ELEKTRA ' It’s nice to have history some place. I ' feel like I'm always shuttling between planes and hotels and countries. There’s : a ball tomorrow night at my father’s hotel that I’m absolutely dreading. o MATT \ So don’t go. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: ELEKTRA
dialogues.text: It‘s not that simple. My father needs me. We're all we have left. Matt suddenly looks up to the sky.

dialogues.speaker: MATT
dialogues.text: Did you bring an umbrella?

dialogues.speaker: ELEKTRA
dialogues.text: Why? Suddenly, THUNDER BOOMS as the rain begins to come.

dialogues.speaker: ELEKTRA, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Come on! Elektra ducks under an awning in the alley, laughing. But Matt stays out in the rain, welcoming it like an old frie

dialogues.speaker: ELEKTRA, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: You’re getting soaked!

dialogues.speaker: MATT
dialogues.text: You know what a nice day is? When there's a breeze. Scraps of leaves and paper dance down the sidewalks giving me a world of detail I'd usually miss... (smiling) But a perfect day is when it rains. We hear the MUTED PATTER of the raindrops now, hitting th leaves overhead, as Elektra listens to Matt’s world.

dialogues.speaker: MATT, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Suddenly there's a roof to the universe ..and everything that was shapeless is given contours and textures... He stops and inhales the world around him. *

dialogues.speaker: MATT, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Car exhaust washes away replaced by the * smell of earth and grass...and for a *

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: moment everything is clear...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where we see the rain visualized as DROPS OF SOUND. Elekt steps closer as they bounce off of her shoulders, her hai the bridge of her nose, until they reveal her in a perfec Silhouette. She's even more beautiful than he imagined. ae ee (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: _ MATT, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: For a moment...I can see again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As she takes his hand and places it on her face.

dialogues.speaker: CU FINGERTIPS
dialogues.text: as Matt slowly caresses her delicate features, the raindr streaming between his fingers and her cheeks in rivulets.

dialogues.speaker: MATT, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: You are so beautiful. They start to kiss. Matt losing himself in the moment... And then the VOICES start. The VOICES that only Matt Murdock can hear.

dialogues.speaker: VOICE
dialogues.text: Take the watch! Just don’t hurt me!

dialogues.speaker: VOICE
dialogues.text: Crank? Base? Watchoo want, mistah? Cuz I got ‘em all.

dialogues.speaker: VOICE
dialogues.text: Take the money outta the register! Matt grits his teeth.

dialogues.speaker: MATT
dialogues.text: No...

dialogues.speaker: ELEKTRA
dialogues.text: What is it?

dialogues.speaker: MATT
dialogues.text: Nothing...

dialogues.speaker: ELEKTRA
dialogues.text: Matt? Matt grimaces. Determined to shut them out. But then we hear the voice of a LITTLE BOY crying. LITTLE BOY‘S VOICE Please! Please don’t hurt me! ABUSIVE FATHER’S VOICE Don't you run from me, boy! (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: And he can’t shut them out anymore.

dialogues.speaker: MATT
dialogues.text: I have to go.

dialogues.speaker: ELEKTRA
dialogues.text: Matt?

dialogues.speaker: MATT
dialogues.text: I’m sorry... Matt hurries off as we STAY ON Elektra’s puzzled reaction

dialogues.speaker: THE ROOFTOPS
dialogues.text: Matt rips open his shirt to reveal the CRIMSON DOUBLE D o the costume he wears underneath. His face a mask of rage.

dialogues.speaker: MATT
dialogues.text: One night. That's all I wanted. One Goddamn night to myself...

dialogues.speaker: CU CANE
dialogues.text: as it's snapped apart into Daredevil’s billy club. It’s folded and holstered as we TILT UP to the face of DAREDEV

dialogues.speaker: DAREDEVIL
dialogues.text: Say your prayers, asshole.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: An ABUSIVE FATHER stumbles down the hallway with greasy h hanging over bloodshot eyes. His voice is thick, drugged.

dialogues.speaker: WHERE ARE YOU
dialogues.text: He pulls the belt from his pants and SLAPS it against the walls as he goes. He stops to see the WINDOW IS OPEN. ABUSIVE FATHER (CONT’D) Did I say you could open this window? You little son of a bitch? We hear WHIMPERING coming from under the stairs. The Fath stumbles over and yanks the LITTLE BOY out before throwin him up against the wall. The boy covers his ears, CRYING. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: LISTEN WHEN I TALK TO YOU
dialogues.text: He raises his belt over his head when--Daredevil’s gloved hand comes into frame and grabs him by the wrist! ABUSIVE FATHER (CONT‘D) What--? Daredevil TWISTS his arm and CRACKS it at the elbow! The Father HOWLS IN PAIN as he crumples to his knees.

dialogues.speaker: DAREDEVIL
dialogues.text: See how it feels?

dialogues.speaker: ABUSIVE FATHER
dialogues.text: I‘11 kill you, motherf--!

dialogues.speaker: DAREDEVIL
dialogues.text: Wrong answer. He GRABS him by the neck and YANKS him up off the floor, shouting at him in the man’s own words: DAREDEVIL (CONT’D) ‘LISTEN-WHEN-I-TALK-TO-YOU! ’ Daredevil’s about to go off when:

dialogues.speaker: NO
dialogues.text: The Little Boy grabs Daredevil’s arm.

dialogues.speaker: LITTLE BOY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Don’t hurt my Dad! Daredevil stops. A BEAT. And then he lets the Father drop to the ground. The Little Boy holds his Father, SOBBING, Daredevil stands there, unsure.

dialogues.speaker: DAREDEVIL
dialogues.text: I’m not the bad guy, kid... But it’s more of a plea than a statement. Daredevil turns and slips out of the dark room as we CuT TO:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where Matt stands overlooking the city. His hood pulled b from his face. Looking sick of the life that he’s created (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: MATT
dialogues.text: I'm not the bad guy...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Their offices are right in between a yellow “CHECKS CASHE sign and a Korean pet service named “U WASH DOGGY.”

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As we meet their secretary/receptionist KAREN PAGE. She's beautiful, wholesome~looking blond who has a thing for Ma which we can sense from the moment he steps in.

dialogues.speaker: KAREN
dialogues.text: Hi, Matt. You got some messages. I typed them into your braille printer.

dialogues.speaker: MATT
dialogues.text: Thanks, Karen. Foggy steps out of his office as Karen hands Matt a fancy gold-embossed invitation.

dialogues.speaker: KAREN
dialogues.text: And this came by messenger this morning. It‘s your invitation to the Black and White Ball at the Grand. Plus one. She smiles, clearly wanting to be asked.

dialogues.speaker: FOGGY
dialogues.text: Plus one? Sweet. Foggy snatches the invitation as Karen glares.

dialogues.speaker: KAREN
dialogues.text: Would you like some coffee?

dialogues.speaker: MATT
dialogues.text: I’m fine, thanks. Matt walks into his office. Foggy holds up his empty cup.

dialogues.speaker: FOGGY
dialogues.text: I'd like coffee. Karen just walks back to her desk. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: FOGGY (CONT’D) O-kay... INT. MATT’S OFFICE - CONTINUOUS The office is crowded with junk--remote control sailboats leisure suits, boxes of shoes, all from the pro bono case the past. Matt steps in and hits a button on a BRAILLE PRINTER as his COURT TRANSCRIPTS begin printing out.

dialogues.speaker: FOGGY
dialogues.text: (reading the invite) How'd you rate? This is the toughest ticket in town.

dialogues.speaker: MATT
dialogues.text: I don’t know. What'd you find on our mystery man?

dialogues.speaker: FOGGY
dialogues.text: Mark Welch? Nothing. No records. No priors. That phone number is a disconnect. It’s like he never existed. Now about this party tonight--

dialogues.speaker: MATT
dialogues.text: I’m not going.

dialogues.speaker: FOGGY
dialogues.text: What? Are you crazy? That place will be crawling with rich people. The kind of people who don’t pay their fees in fish.

dialogues.speaker: MATT
dialogues.text: Then you go.

dialogues.speaker: FOGGY
dialogues.text: I‘ma Plus One. Plus Ones can’t get into anything by themselves. (stops) This is about Elektra, isn’t it?

dialogues.speaker: MATT
dialogues.text: No.

dialogues.speaker: FOGGY
dialogues.text: That‘s it. Natchios owns the Grand. She's the one who invited you. This is getting serious, isn’t it? (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: MATT
dialogues.text: Not exactly. I blew it last night.

dialogues.speaker: FOGGY
dialogues.text: What happened? Foggy picks up a Nerf basketball from Matt’s desk.

dialogues.speaker: MATT
dialogues.text: It‘s hard to explain... Foggy shoots but hits the rim.

dialogues.speaker: FOGGY
dialogues.text: Karen said it was messengered this Morning. So at least one of you isn’t giving up so easily. Ball. Foggy tosses him the Nerf ball. Matt throws a perfect SWI

dialogues.speaker: MATT
dialogues.text: I don't wanna talk about it.

dialogues.speaker: FOGGY
dialogues.text: Right. God forbid you share anything personal with your best friend. Foggy shoots again, this time missing completely.

dialogues.speaker: FOGGY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Swish. Matt smirks. FOGGY (CONT’D) Look, can I speak to you as your friend for a second and not as a whore monger?

dialogues.speaker: MATT
dialogues.text: Only if it’s for a second.

dialogues.speaker: FOGGY
dialogues.text: That whole love-at-first-sight thing? Never happened to me. I always thought it was some crap Hallmark invented to push product on Valentine’s Day. Until I saw you two in that coffee shop. Ball. Matt catches the Nerf ball as he thinks that over.

dialogues.speaker: MATT
dialogues.text: Plus One, huh? (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Foggy grins. Matt hits nothin’ but net as we...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A luxurious old-time hotel along the lines of the St. Reg or the Plaza. Matt and Foggy make their way through.

dialogues.speaker: FOGGY
dialogues.text: Do you know how much money is here tonight? One new client and we could be set for a year. Matt suddenly catches a WHIFF OF CIGARETTE SMOKE as:

dialogues.speaker: URICH, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Matt Murdock?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: to reveal Ben Urich stepping over. Matt tenses.

dialogues.speaker: URICH, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Ben Urich with the Post. They shake hands.

dialogues.speaker: MATT
dialogues.text: This is my partner Franklin Nelson.

dialogues.speaker: FOGGY
dialogues.text: That's “N-e-l-s-o-n.”

dialogues.speaker: MATT
dialogues.text: You were at the Cordoza trial.

dialogues.speaker: URICH
dialogues.text: That's right.

dialogues.speaker: MATT
dialogues.text: You're covering it for the paper?

dialogues.speaker: URICH
dialogues.text: No. Not really. Curious, that’s all. Urich offers them his business card. URICH (CONT’D) Here's my number. Give me a call if anything comes up. (CONTINUED)

But as he does he accidentally knocks Matt’s RED CANE out his hands. It hits the floor with a CLATTER. URICH (CONT’D) Sorry. Urich picks it back up, noticing... URICH (CONT’D) Interesting color. Matt quickly takes it away.

dialogues.speaker: MATT
dialogues.text: I wouldn’t know. But then Matt stops as he hears the sound of a heavy BASS HEARTBEAT approaching. A HUGE SHADOW falls over them as:

dialogues.speaker: FISK, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: I didn’t expect to see you here, Mr. Urich. to reveal Wilson Fisk. Wesley is at his side, as always.

dialogues.speaker: FISK, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Not relegated to covering the society pages I hope?

dialogues.speaker: URICH
dialogues.text: Comped some tickets from my publisher. Thought I‘d get a word in with Natchios.

dialogues.speaker: FISK
dialogues.text: Still chasing the boogie man?

dialogues.speaker: URICH
dialogues.text: Something like that. Fisk offers his hand to Matt.

dialogues.speaker: FISK
dialogues.text: Wilson Fisk. They shake, Matt's hand is swallowed up in his.

dialogues.speaker: MATT
dialogues.text: Matt Murdock. I’ve heard a lot about you, Mr. Fisk. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: PISK
dialogues.text: Hopefully not from Mr. Urich here. Foggy hands Fisk his card.

dialogues.speaker: FOGGY
dialogues.text: Franklin Nelson. Nelson and Murdock. That’s our card. You can keep it.

dialogues.speaker: FISK
dialogues.text: Wonderful.

dialogues.speaker: MATT
dialogues.text: You used to promote fights at the Garden, didn’t you, Mr. Fisk?

dialogues.speaker: FISK
dialogues.text: That was a long time ago. You're a boxing fan, Matt?

dialogues.speaker: MATT
dialogues.text: My father was a fighter. Jack Murdock. Fisk stops. Smiles.

dialogues.speaker: FISK
dialogues.text: I remember your father. He was a solid heavyweight. Whatever happened to him?

dialogues.speaker: MATT
dialogues.text: Fight game didn’t agree with him.

dialogues.speaker: FISK
dialogues.text: It can be a brutal business.

dialogues.speaker: MATT
dialogues.text: Yes it can. Fisk pats Matt on the shoulder.

dialogues.speaker: FISK
dialogues.text: Nice meeting you, gentlemen. He walks off with Urich in his wake.

dialogues.speaker: URICH
dialogues.text: Mr. Fisk one more thing... Foggy gives a low whistle as he watches him go. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: FOGGY
dialogues.text: Wow. Talk about a side of beef. (noticing) Hey, you okay? Matt shakes it off.

dialogues.speaker: MATT
dialogues.text: Yeah. Fine. Foggy suddenly stops as he sees...

dialogues.speaker: ELEKTRA
dialogues.text: walking their way. She looks absolutely breath-taking.

dialogues.speaker: FOGGY
dialogues.text: Oh wow. The crowd parts for her like the Red Sea. FOGGY (CONT’D) If I could give you my eyes for one night, buddy, it’d be tonight.

dialogues.speaker: MATT
dialogues.text: Like that, huh?

dialogues.speaker: FOGGY
dialogues.text: Like that. I’m gonna be at the bar if you need me. (stops) . You don’t think it’s a cash bar, do you?

dialogues.speaker: MATT
dialogues.text: Go. Foggy slips through the crowd as Elektra steps over.

dialogues.speaker: ELEKTRA
dialogues.text: You look fantastic.

dialogues.speaker: MATT
